item.description:
Bradley-Palmer State Park

(along with adjoining Willowdale Woods) offers over 2,000 acres and about 60 miles of trails for hikers, mountain bikers, and equestrians along the Ipswich River.

It's just a few miles outside of Ipswich village, where an historic pub awaits at the end of the hike.

The park section was once an estate and contains miles of carriage roads, blooming rhododendrons, and an old manor house. The forest section is wilder, with miles of forest and wetlands.

There are glacial kettle ponds, amphibian-filled vernal pools, a fish ladder, a 19th-century mill dam, and a pine-woods swamp. We'll hike for 3-4 hours, then head to Choate Bridge Pub in Ipswich Village for a cold beer and great food.

Portsmouth Carpool: 10:15am @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. Meet in the the overflow lot - the lot farthest from the main bus terminal building. Meet at the back of the lot.

Newburyport Carpool: 10:30am @ Storey Ave Park & Ride.

Please share expenses with your driver.

* Bradley-Palmer is just 25 mins from Newburyport & 40 mins from Portsmouth.

Directions: Turn into the park from Asbury St. Then bear right. Then turn right at the State Park road intersection.

Click here for an explanation of event fees.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup.

Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

*Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Bradley-Palmer State Park & Choate Bridge Pub!
